title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set on data set editor page of the query tab
OB: No children node is listed when changing the data source for a data set on the data set editor page of the query tab.
EB: When changing the data source for a data set on the data set editor page of the query tab, the children node should be listed.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement.
2. Go to the data set editor data source page.
3. Change the data source to a new one.
4. Verify that the new data source does not have any database/table/column information listed.

Expected result:
- The children node should be listed when changing the data source for a data set on the data set editor page of the query tab.

Additional steps to try resolving the issue:
1. Close the data set editor.
2. Reopen it and verify if the children node is now listed.
